docs.snippet: Mr. JOHN D. WILLARD reported favorably the bill to provide for the descent of lands to aliens. Mr. CHARLES H. SHERRILL, Canal Commissioner, presented a communication stating that the aggregate cost of raising the canal bridges to the height of...
docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. JOHN D. WILLARD reported favorably the bill to provide for the descent of lands to aliens. Mr. CHARLES H. SHERRILL, Canal Commissioner, presented a communication stating that the aggregate cost of raising the canal bridges to the height of nineteen feet, on the Eastern D. vision will be $25,000, and urging the work, as demanded immediately by the necessities of navigation.

docs.snippet: THE NEAPOLITAN EXILES.-The steamship Weser, which arrived at this port on the 18th inst., reports having passed, on the 6th inst, the Baltimore ship David Stewart, bound to Queenstown. No mention is made of the vessel being in distress.
docs.lead_paragraph: THE NEAPOLITAN EXILES.-The steamship Weser, which arrived at this port on the 18th inst., reports having passed, on the 6th inst, the Baltimore ship David Stewart, bound to Queenstown. No mention is made of the vessel being in distress.

headline.main: NEWS BY TELEGRAPH.; FROM WASHINGTON. No Extra Session of Congress - Mexican Affairs.

docs.lead_paragraph: The President, having yielded to the views of the Cabinet, telegraphed to New-York to say that no Extra Session would be called. Dispatches just received from Mr. CHURCHWELL represent the cause of the Mexican Liberals as improving, and that there is a great probability of the speedy recognition of the Juarez Government.

headline.main: INTERESTING FROM MEXICO.; Injustice of England and France towards Americans. The New Cabinet--General Intelligence from the Departments. Proceedings of the French and English Commanders at Vera Cruz.

docs.lead_paragraph: Since the date of my last letter to you, on the 5th inst.. events have transpired of more than usual importance. For convenience, I will detail them to you in chronological order. ANOTHER HEAVY FORCED LOAN. On the 7th inst., a decree was publlshed imposing a contribution of 1 per cent. upon the capitall of persons residing in Mexico. no matter whether their capital be here or in any other part of the world.

docs.snippet: The Mexican mail brings us our usual letter from the capital, which, while it still gives the latest news from that point, should have reached us a fortnight ago. Our dates from Vera Cruz are, therefore, nearly three weeks later, and, in a measure,...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Mexican mail brings us our usual letter from the capital, which, while it still gives the latest news from that point, should have reached us a fortnight ago. Our dates from Vera Cruz are, therefore, nearly three weeks later, and, in a measure, supersede the intelligence supplied by our correspondent. The imposition of the forced loan
